title: Scotland
author: Scotland
content: Hello, after 24 hours, I write a message in the form of ''Daily bump'' on my trade postings and make it go up.but after 24 hours i got banned again even though i did it.what should i do, what's the rule? please someone explain this to me

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: There's nothing bad in bumping a thread but have you taken your time to read about the rules and regulations associated to bumpingÂ  thread, also I don't know what kind of bump you made, i believe by now you should know that plagiarism is a great offence to do even if you're advertising or creating a bump to your thread, if what you got at the first stance was temporary ban then you have failed in realising the cause making you to made that same mistake.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Looking at your post history, it looks like you are not deleting your previous "bump" on your thread before posting a new one. And perhaps, someone reported it to the moderator because they found it annoying. Maybe try consolidating your ads in 1 thread?Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0Bumps, "updates" are limited to once per 24 hours per thread. Bumping multiple threads at the same time is allowed if it's not annoying.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: How long were you banned for? It was likely the lack of deleting previous bumps as stated above (it'll make your thread look neater too if you do that).If you post updates in your bump you can consolate them all into your first or second post (and can do it via copying what comes up when you click quote if you want too).

comments.author: Scotland
comments.body: Many thanks for your messages.I keep getting messages like this.so should i delete my old post before bumping the topic? sorry for my english

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: Scotland on January 10, 2023, 11:56:43 AMso should i delete my old post before bumping the topic? sorry for my englishCheck rule no. 21 on the list of unofficial rules[1]. The rules on deleting previous bumps is clear there.As a rule of thumb, besides looking through the forum rules always check to ensure that your activities are not annoying to other forum members.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0- Jay -

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Scotland on January 10, 2023, 11:56:43 AMso should i delete my old post before bumping the topic? sorry for my englishYou can only delete your old post after 24 hours, so if you didn't delete it, it's considered spamming or an unsubstantial post, and if you continue doing this habit it could be the ban hammer will occur into your account and AFAIK, this was the punishments.1st offense: 7 days ban2nd offense: 14 days ban3rd offense: 30 days ban4th offense: Permanent banBe careful next time if you care about your account.

comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on January 10, 2023, 03:46:11 PMQuote from: Scotland on January 10, 2023, 11:56:43 AMso should i delete my old post before bumping the topic? sorry for my englishYou can only delete your old post after 24 hours, so if you didn't delete it, it's considered spamming or an unsubstantial post, and if you continue doing this habit it could be the ban hammer will occur into your account and AFAIK, this was the punishments.1st offense: 7 days ban2nd offense: 14 days ban3rd offense: 30 days ban4th offense: Permanent banBe careful next time if you care about your account. I just learnt something new. Although I don't run services that is why I don't remember the rule of deleting older bumps after 24hrs.If I should ask, are there special reasons for that if not making the person's posting profile neat?What is the concern of the forum about a user personal profile?I ask because I have seen the post history of some bounty hunters filled with links upon links and they are neither deleted or temporarily banned.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on January 10, 2023, 03:46:11 PMQuote from: Scotland on January 10, 2023, 11:56:43 AMso should i delete my old post before bumping the topic? sorry for my englishYou can only delete your old post after 24 hours, so if you didn't delete it, it's considered spamming or an unsubstantial post, and if you continue doing this habit it could be the ban hammer will occur into your account and AFAIK, this was the punishments.1st offense: 7 days ban2nd offense: 14 days ban3rd offense: 30 days ban4th offense: Permanent banBe careful next time if you care about your account. Definitely, here is what applies. I'm sure to have seen this rule before although, I was wondering how do one gets banned twice. You didn't state it to be a temporal ban or something but, yeah. Spamming could earn you some bans as, you end up giving moderators more job to do everyday with certain repeated behaviour like just bumping. This counts as spam, becomes annoying and attracts some punishments.Perhaps if you had other posts just after at other times, if would be less detasteful so, you could try doing that.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: uchegod-21 on January 10, 2023, 08:49:55 PMIf I should ask, are there special reasons for that if not making the person's posting profile neat?That is what I can deduce from the rule and also to reduce thread filling with bumps. Some users can boost their ANN thread with multiple bumps and it would give the impression that there is so much discussion going on it, while there isn't.It could also be to reduce activity boosting which used to be a thing when account farming was was to do without merits.Quote from: uchegod-21 on January 10, 2023, 08:49:55 PMI ask because I have seen the post history of some bounty hunters filled with links upon links and they are neither deleted or temporarily banned.Bounty spam is limited to certain boards and doesn't exactly break any forum rules.

comments.body: Thank you for the messages, I think I understand now, I will delete my old post and write a new one
